original_title: MullenLowe’s senior leadership in town this week, demonstrates support to rebounding Sri Lanka
original_body_lines: Senior leadership of MullenLowe will be in Sri Lanka this week demonstrating its support to the country’s post-crises revival.

The delegation includes Asia Pacific and Global Chair Chief Strategy Officer and MullenLowe India Group Chief Executive Officer S. Subramanyeswar (Subbu), MullenLowe India Chief Operating Officer/Chief Financial Officer Vivek Kamath and Unilever IPG Team Chief Operating Officer Helen Bell.
They will be engaged in a series of client meetings and evening forums this week.

They are the senior most professionals from MullenLowe Group Worldwide (Inter Public Group) to visit Sri Lanka post the pandemic and the financial crisis to support the business and help clients rebound from the unfortunate setbacks the country has experienced in the recent past.

Subbu will be speaking at the Bonvoy Marriott [Courtyard by Marriott Colombo] on 29 June at 6.30 p.m. at an exclusive invitee only event and on the 30 June at Ramada Hotel Colombo at an Association of Accredited Advertising Agency (4As) ticketed event.

MullenLowe Sri Lanka is one of the country’s foremost marketing communications companies driving change through its 8 strategic verticals by incorporating Strategic Creative, Technology, Media, Digital, Public Relations and Activations and will be exporting MarTech services to overseas markets by end of the year. The company has been top ranked regionally and globally on multiple occasions, including at Effies and named Effie Agency Of The Year in Sri Lanka.
